xmlDeviceConfiguration Module¶

Created on Sep 13, 2012

@author: Gary

exception housemonitor.configuration.xmlDeviceConfiguration.InvalidConfigurationOptionError(device, port=None, option=None)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

This exception will be raised when an invalid configuration option is raised.

exception housemonitor.configuration.xmlDeviceConfiguration.InvalidDeviceError(device=None)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

This exception will be raised when than invalid device was used.

exception housemonitor.configuration.xmlDeviceConfiguration.InvalidPortError(port=None)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

This exception will be raised when than invalid port is used.

class housemonitor.configuration.xmlDeviceConfiguration.xmlDeviceConfiguration[source]¶

Bases: housemonitor.configuration.xmlconfiguration.XmlConfiguration, object

configuration_file_name[source]¶
configuration_topic_name[source]¶
configure()[source]¶
devices = {}¶
get(device=None, port=None, name=None)[source]¶

Get the steps (ie routines to execute) given the device and the port.

Parameters:
  • device – the device ie. its source address, network address, or its name)
  • port – the port name on the xbee. ie dio-0, adc-1
  • name – name of the configuration item to get. ie (description, name, cosm_channel)
Returns :

a list of the steps for this device
Raises :

InvalidDeviceError, InvalidPortError, InvalidConfigurationOptionError
get_name(device)[source]¶

Get the name of a device given the device.

Parameters:
  • device – the device ie. its source address, network address, or its name)
  • port – the port name on the xbee. ie dio-0, adc-1
Returns :

a list of the steps for this device
Raises :

InvalidDeviceError, InvalidPortError, InvalidConfigurationOptionError

logger_name[source]¶

Set the logger level. This needs to be added to house_monitoring_logging.conf

process_configuration(parent)[source]¶

This routine will walk to xml tree and extract the information. It does this by creating a dictionary entry for each node in the xml file. It uses the tag as the key and text as the value.

Parameters:parent – the node in the xml file
Return :the parsed element tree if the file can be successfully read and parsed.
Raises :ConfigurationFileNotFoundError
valid_device(device)[source]¶

Check to see if device is in the configuration file.

Parameters:device – the device ie. its source address, network address, or its name)
Raises :InvalidDeviceError

xmlconfiguration Module¶

Created on Aug 6, 2012

@author: Gary

This module is for reading xml Configuration files.

exception housemonitor.configuration.xmlconfiguration.ConfigurationFileError(value)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

This exception will be raised when there is a error in the xml file. For example an invalid list type, or a duplicate entry in each section.

exception housemonitor.configuration.xmlconfiguration.ConfigurationFileNotFoundError(value)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

This exception will be raised when the requested xml file can not be found.

class housemonitor.configuration.xmlconfiguration.XmlConfiguration[source]¶

Bases: housemonitor.configuration.abc_configuration.abcConfiguration

This class will read an XML configuration file in the config directory

DIRECTORIES = ['C:\\Users\\Gary\\git\\HouseMonitor\\HouseMonitor\\docs', 'config']¶
config = {}¶
configure(filename=None)[source]¶

configure is the concrete method for configuring a class.

configutation_directory = 'C:\\Users\\Gary\\git\\HouseMonitor\\HouseMonitor\\docs\\config'¶
file_name(filename=None)[source]¶

Generate a path for the xml configuration file.

Param filename:the name of the configuration file
Returns:the relative path to the configuation file
Raises :ConfigurationFileNotFoundExceptioon
parse_xml_file(filename=None)[source]¶

parse_xml_file does three things: 1. build the configuration filename 2. open the file for reading 3. parse the file using ElementTree

Parameters:name – the name of the configuration file
Return :a parsed element tree if the file can be successfully read and parsed.
Raises :ConfigurationFileNotFoundError
process_configuration(parent)[source]¶

This routine will walk to xml tree and extract the information. It does this by creating a dictionary entry for each node in the xml file. It uses the tag as the key and text as the value.

Args:
parent is the node in the xml file
Return:

a parsed element tree if the file can be successfully read and parsed.

Exceptions: ConfigurationFileNotFoundError
